name: Oak's Lab
description: Choose your starter Pokémon in Professor Oak's Lab

name: Route 1
description: The road to Viridian City

name: Viridian City
description: Viridian City is the first town after exiting Route 1.

name: Route 22
description: West of Viridian City - Rival battle to unlock Secret Garden

name: Secret Garden
description: Optional area unlocked by defeating rival on Route 22

name: Route 2
description: Before Viridian Forest

name: Viridian Forest
description: Home of Bug-type Pokémon

name: Hidden Forest
description: Hidden area in Viridian Forest

name: Pewter City
description: Pewter City is accessed from the South from Route 2 (After the Forest) and to the East from Route 3

name: Route 3
description: Path to Mt. Moon

name: Mt. Moon
description: Mt. Moon is a mountain in the Kanto region.

name: Route 4
description: After Mt. Moon, path to Cerulean City

name: Cerulean City
description: This city contains Cerulean City's Gym, with Misty as its leader.

name: Route 24
description: Nugget Bridge north of Cerulean City

name: Cerulean Cape
description: contains Bill's Lighthouse. It is connected to Route 25 and Route 23

name: Route 5
description: South of Cerulean City

name: Route 6
description: North of Vermillion City

name: Vermillion City
description: This city contains Vermillion City's Gym, with Lt. Surge as its leader.

name: Route 11
description: East of Vermillion City

name: Route 9
description: East of Cerulean City

name: Route 10
description: This route is a fork with a PokéCenter in its Center. It connects Route 9, Rock Tunnel and the Power Plant.

name: Rock Tunnel
description: Rock Tunnel is a dark cavern which splits the sections of Route 10.

name: Lavender Town
description: Lavender Town can be accessed from the North by Route 10 (After Rock Tunnel), the West by Route 8, and the South by Route 12.

name: Route 8
description: East of Celadon City, path to Lavender Town

name: Route 7
description: West of Celadon City

name: Celadon City
description: Celadon City is a big city, with two entries: Route 16 to the West and Route 7 to the East.

name: Celadon Sewers
description: Team Rocket have a hideout within Celadon Sewers.

name: Pokemon Tower
description: This is a burial ground for Pokémon, located in Lavender Town.

name: Route 12
description: South of Lavender Town

name: Route 13
description: Route with many trainers

name: Route 14
description: Continuing south

name: Route 15
description: West toward Fuchsia City

name: Route 16
description: Cycling Road entrance

name: Viridian River
description: River area near Viridian City

name: Route 17
description: Cycling Road

name: Route 18
description: Cycling Road exit

name: Fuchsia City
description: Fuchsia City has the famous Safari Zone, and can be accessed West by Route 18, East by Route 15, and South by Route 19.

name: Safari Zone
description: Safari Zone is a large area in Fuchsia City, with many wild Pokémon to catch.

name: Saffron City
description: Saffron City is a big city, with two entries: Route 25 to the West and Route 24 to the East.

name: Creepy House
description: The basement is filled with ghost Pokémon, with several small rooms: the main hall, a classroom, a library, a restroom, and a piano room.

name: Route 23
description: Victory Road entrance

name: Secret Forest
description: The Secret Forest is a secret area you can only enter after obtaining 4 badges.

name: Route 19
description: Surfing south from Fuchsia City, contains the Seafoam Islands

name: Route 20
description: Seafoam Islands route

name: Seafoam Islands
description: Seafoam Islands are a group of islands in the Seafoam Islands. They are home to many wild Pokémon, including the legendary Pokémon, Articuno.

name: Cinnabar Island
description: This town is accessible from Route 20 or Route 21, or by the Seagallop Ferry

name: Pokemon Mansion
description: Pokémon Mansion was burnt down due to a scientific experiment gone wrong.

name: Offshore road
description: Offshore Road is a water route between Kanto's Cinnabar Island and Sevii Islands' Kindle Road.

name: Mt. Ember
description: Mt. Ember is a mountain in the Kanto region. It is home to the legendary Pokémon, Moltres.

name: Power Plant
description: The Power Plant is a large building in the Kanto region. It is home to the legendary Pokémon, Zapdos.

name: Route 21
description: South of Pallet Town

name: Pallet Town
description: Where it all started

name: Route 26
description: Route 26 is a route that connects Route 22, Route 27 to Pokemon League Gate.

name: Route 27
description: Route 27 is a route that connects Route 26 to New Bark Town.

name: Tohjo Falls
description: Tohjo Falls is connected to Route 27 at several locations. Players pass here to go towards the Pokemon league, and Waterfall is required to access the Western portion.

name: Victory Road
description: The final route before the Pokemon League

name: Goldenrod City
description: Goldenrod City Features the Radio Tower and the Train Station connecting to Saffron City in Kanto.

name: Route 35
description: Route 35 is a route that connects Goldenrod City to the National Park. There is also a small shortcut to reach Route 36 directly.

name: Route 36
description: Route 36 is a route that connects Violet City to the National Park, Route 37 and the Ruins of Alph. There is also a small shortcut to reach Route 35 directly without going through the National Park.

name: Route 32
description: South of Violet City, fishing area

name: Route 34
description: Route 34 is a route that connects Goldenrod City to Ilex Forest.

name: Ilex Forest
description: Ilex Forest is twisted path in a dense forest that connects Route 34 to Azalea Town.

name: Route 35
description: National Park area

name: Azalea Town
description: Azalea Town exits West into Ilex Forest and East to Route 33.

name: Slowpoke Well
description: Slowpoke Well is a small cave that connects Azalea Town to the National Park. It is home to the legendary Pokémon, Slowpoke.

name: Route 33
description: Route 33 is a route that connects Azalea Town to Union Cave.

name: Union Cave
description: Union Cave can be accessed by the South from Route 33 and the North from Route 32.

name: Ruins of Alph
description: Ruins Of Alph can be accessed from the North by Route 36 and from the East by Route 32.

name: Violet City
description: Violet City can be accessed from the West via Route 36, the South via Route 32, and the East via Route 31.

name: Route 31
description: Route 31 is a route that connects Violet City to both Route 30 and the Dark Cave.

name: Dark Cave
description: Dark Cave is a cave that connects Route 31 to Route 30.

name: Route 30
description: Route 30 is a route that connects Route 31 to Cherrygrove City.

name: Cherrygrove City
description: Cherrygrove City is a small town that can be entered from Route 30 by the North and from Route 29 by the East.

name: Route 29
description: Route 29 is a route that connects Cherrygrove City to New Bark Town. There is an access to Route 46 near the middle of the path.

name: Route 46
description: Route 46 is a dead-end path that can be accessed from Route 29.

name: New Bark Town
description: New Bark Town is a small town that can be entered from Route 29 by the West and from Route 27 by the East.

name: Cerulean Cave
description: Cerulean Cave is located near Cerulean City, Surf and climb the waterfall to reach it.

name: Blackthorn City
description: Blackthorn City can be accessed by the Dark Cave from the South and by the Ice Mountains from the North.

name: Ice Mountains
description: Ice Mountains is a chain of mountains that can be accessed by the West from Route 44 and by the East from Blackthorn City.

name: Hall of Origin
description: The Hall of Origin a location in the sky above Ice Mountains Peak, only accessible by using the Azure Flute obtained from Eusine in Cherrygrove City.

name: Route 44
description: Route 44 is a route that connects Mahogany Town to Ice Mountains.

name: Mahogany Town
description: Mahogany Town is a small town, that is accessed from the North via Route 43, the West via Route 42, and the East via Route 44.

name: Route 42
description: Route 42 is a route that connects Ecruteak City to Mahogany Town. Mt. Mortar can be accessed from either side.

name: Mt. Mortar
description: Mt. Mortar is a dark cave that can only be accessed from Route 42.

name: Ecruteak City
description: Ecruteak City can be accessed from the East by Route 42 and from the South by Route 37.

name: Route 43
description: Route 43 is a route that connects Mahogany Town to the Lake of Rage.

name: Lake of Rage
description: The Lake of Rage can be accessed from Route 43.
